text: <@U4H19D1D2> whats your take on thread safety? I'm running a separate thread for making keep alive calls on an APIClient object which is being used in other threads; it's not entirely clear from what I've read online that a requests session is thread safe - can you think of any issues making simultaneous API calls using the same APIClient object from multiple threads?

elements.text: whats your take on thread safety? I'm running a separate thread for making keep alive calls on an APIClient object which is being used in other threads; it's not entirely clear from what I've read online that a requests session is thread safe - can you think of any issues making simultaneous API calls using the same APIClient object from multiple threads?

text: The client creates a new session on each request unless you supply a session object, as <http://requests.post|requests.post> will create a new session if not supplied. I use a session per thread as I was getting errors when trying to share

elements.text: The client creates a new session on each request unless you supply a session object, as
requests.post
will create a new session if not supplied. I use a session per thread as I was getting errors when trying to share

text: so by default its thread safe; and presumably you get better performance creating a session for each thread to use?

elements.text: so by default its thread safe; and presumably you get better performance creating a session for each thread to use?
